lines.text: You drinkin' that stuff so early?
Listen, doll girl, when you drink as much as I do, you gotta start early.
Occasionally I always drink too much.
I don't like it at all, Mr. Mulloy.
Well, I'm sorry to hear that. I wish I knew what you were talking about.

[door opens]
Fletcher apartment?
I don't need any brushes, but come on in.
Mrs. Fletcher?
Yes.
I'd like to see your husband.
Well, that's not very flattering. Would you like some coffee?
Oh, a second cup never hurt anybody.
Would you kill me, Rocky?
Wouldn't you?
Well, the place looks lived in.
Yeah, but by what?

So what if a bookie gets hit hard? It's a big joke. Big joke. Never occurs to you that I've got a wife and kids like other people. Well, there goes the two weeks at camp I promised the kids this summer.
You're a pint ahead of schedule.
Only the blind can really see.
Well, you're only half blind.
I'll fix that.
You know, I had another friend once who had trouble with that stuff. He found a way to get off of it.
How?
He quit.
Thank you, Billy Sunday.
Say, you've got all my dough. How about some cab fare?
What're you gonna pay me back with, some more of that hot money?
Maybe all of it.
All right, there's 20. That's out of my own pocket. Remember, I've got a wife and a couple of kids.
I haven't met anybody lately who hasn't.
Now, just get it through your heads that the pressure's on.
[to Nancy]
I wouldn't give a nickel for your husband's chances before that parole board with all this going on.
[to Rocky]
And I wouldn't give a nickel for your chances with those two apes running around looking for you.
[to Castro]
For you, I just wouldn't give a nickel.

[Seeing Mulloy's picture on Page One of the paper]
Nice picture, isn't it?
Add five years to it, and it'd look just like me.
You buy nice drinks, mister.
But you talk too much.
What happens if the police come?
We're old friends. We'll always find something to talk about.

[as Mulloy exits the trailer park shower]
Did you turn off the shower?

[Deadpanned]
I couldn't even turn it on.

[to Darlene]
Let's get out of this sun and into a nice cool bar.
And do me a favor Castro, while I'm on the phone, try and jump me. I'd like nothing better thsn to give it to you in the belly.

[after Mrs. Fletcher opens the door]
Is this your apartment?
I don't need any brushes, but come on in.
